publicationStmt.publisher: Schenker Documents Online in association with the Centre for Computing in the Humanities

sourceDesc.p: No source: created in electronic format.

encodingDesc.p: Encoding according to the CCH TEI Guidelines

div.p: Important collector of autograph manuscripts, and industrialist living in Dessau, Germany.

Meinert possessed several Beethoven autographs (today in the Beethovenhaus, Bonn), e.g. Op. 27/2 (the "Moonlight" Sonata, of which Schenker published a facsimile in 1921), and Op. 101 (of which Schenker produced an edition with elucidations in 1920).

div.head: Correspondence
div.p: No correspondence between Meinert and Schenker is known to survive, but Meinert is several times mentioned in letters by Schenker (e. g. WSLB 191.579, June 25, 1913, to Otto Erich Deutsch; WSLB 210, May 2, 1914, to Emil Hertzka).
